item.title: runconf18
item.description: Worked on this package at @rOpenSci’s 2018 Unconf.

item.title: how I organise my thoughts and time
item.description: my current systems Updated: 2018-06-12 I wonder if all or some of this should move to the dontpanic readme. pieces piano practice/task switching/pomodoor bullet journal, used to be as portable as possible blog to see if I’ve made any progress on my study problems for today, to track my productivity system, and to learn about my research problems; in short, blog for me, don’t worry about anyone else: but keep it to those three categories; one category per post, etc.

item.title: ikigai := mathematics
item.description: work can be so much fun how do you like to spend your day? let’s rethink do what you love advice not: what do you like? but, how do you want to spend your day? ikigai my ikigai what you love this is how I like to spend my day what the world needs ecological research, cancer what you can get paid for statistics and data science are highly sought after skills

item.title: news
item.description: events in 2018 event date role Evidence Synthesis Hackathon La Trobe University Choose Maths day June 4 10 minute speech to school children about the Japanese concept of ikigai and how I find ikigai in practicing mathematical science and a panel session Q & A. useR! 2018
